chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens
Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Mariah M. Earnest was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).
  • Battery to Emergency Rescue Worker, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(7)(b).
  • Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.    Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided - for Cts 1 & 3.
** Pay DNA surcharges.  Perform 100 hrs of community service work for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable orgainization.  May not associate with gangs/gang members or gang affiliations or disruptive groups.  May Not have contact with David Yandel or Kaithlyn Paskiewicz unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  No association with any individuals who use or traffic in controlled substances.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
++  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges - as previously ordered - STILL  due and owing & TO BE PAID DURING EXTENDED SUPERVISION.
++  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given - Unless previously provided - STILL due and owing & TO BE PAID DURING EXTENDED SUPERVISION. Perform 100 hours of community service work for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization - Unless previously done.  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not associate with gangs/gang members or gang affiliations - disruptive groups.  May Not have contact with David Y or Kaitlyn P unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.   May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  No association with any individuals who uses or traffics in controlled substances.

Counts 1 & 3 - 4 yrs WSP; 1 1/2 yrs Initial followed by 2 1/2 yrs ES.  Not eligible for CIP or SAP

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Lynn Bureta.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification.  Sentencing arguments made.  Counts 1 & 3 - DE is sentenced to 4 years in the WSP forthwith; 1 1/2 years Initial Confinement followed by 2 1/2 years Extended Supervision.  Sentence credit for 144 days.  Count 5 - DE is sentenced to 9 months in the KCJ forthwith.  All 3 counts are Concurrent.  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  DE is ordered to complete 100 hours of community service unless completed during prior supervision.  Submit and pay DNA surcharge unless previously paid.  Any unpaid court costs remaining shall be paid during extended supervision.  No contact with David Y. or Kaitlyn P. unless permitted by the court  or agent.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Mariah M. Earnest, appeared with Attorney Mackenzie Renner.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.   
Counts 1 & 3 - Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 3 years with conditions.  
Count 5 - Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 1 year with conditions concurrent to Count 1.  
Credit for 4 days if revoked.  As a condition DE is ordered to complete 100 hrs of community service.  No contact with David Y. or Kaitlyn P.  See conditions.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
